text: if you love applesauce then you're going
to love apple butter layered in between
a beautifully Airy chiffon cake let's
start with the apple butter six and a
half cups of really any apple sauce will
do put this right into a 9 by 13 baking
dish cup and a quarter of light brown
sugar and a quarter teaspoon of allspice
which is a really nice flavor with
apples 1 teaspoon of cinnamon of course
cinnamon apples a perfect pairing this
just gets stirred right in the pan ok
that looks pretty well mixed this is
going to go into a 325 degree oven you
want to stir it every 30 minutes or so
into the oven it goes ok here is our
gorgeous apple butter it's been almost 2
hours and now it's nice and cool you can
see it's much thicker and very dark
golden brown it looks perfect ok now for
our chiffon cake I have two and a
quarter cups of cake flour here this is
a very nice light flour that'll give a
nice light crumb to the cake so to this
I'm going to add 2 teaspoons of baking
powder teaspoon of course salt 3/4 cup
of sugar
Swiss this together and in the other
bowl I have egg yolks 7 egg yolks 1
stick of melted butter right in there
make sure it's not too hot you don't
want to scramble your yolks and then 3/4
of a cup of whole milk you just add your
dry ingredients to the wet ingredients
and they go
and give it a whisk to this we're going
to add the beaten egg whites I have 8
room-temperature egg whites very
important that they are room temperature
so that you get the most loft from them
so I'm going to start them beating just
get them kind of frothy and I'm gonna
add 1/2 a teaspoon of cream of tartar
this will help stabilize the egg whites
so I'm going to slowly add the sugar
about a tablespoon at a time just so
that it incorporates very well into the
egg whites okay now this is going to
continue beating until it's about stiff
glossy Peaks okay let's check where we
are
it's nice stiff peaks
okay now this gets folded into our egg
yolk base so about 1/3 of the whites go
into the base this is just to lighten
the base so I'm going to use the whisk
this will make it easier to fold the
remaining egg whites in okay down
through the center and lift up and turn
the bowl as you go this is the best way
to fold keep folding until you don't see
any more streaks of white I have a
springform pan prepared this is a 9 by 3
inch high springform pan I've buttered
it lined the base with parchment and
buttered again so all this batter is
going to go into a 325 degree oven until
the top springs back it will take about
50 to 55 minutes
okay I have my gorgeous coold beautiful
chiffon cake the dark and lovely apple
butter and I'm going to split this tall
cake into fours so I like to use a
really large serrated knife to do this
and I'm gonna start by just cutting it
in half okay I'm all the way through to
the side and then split this bottom
layer and bring back just top layer to
split this one so this is our bottom
layer to this I'm going to add one cup
of the apple butter okay now because is
this going to get a lot of layers I
don't want to spread this all the way to
the edges cake weight will do that for
me so next layer it's looking great
already and now for some whipped cream
on top I have a cup and a quarter of
heavy cream that I've whipped with two
tablespoons of confectioner's sugar
okay that looks great so now the final
touch a little bit of cinnamon over the
top
okay our cake is done and this is a
thing of beauty so pretty I like to use
a small serrated knife to cut this to
get through those kind of fine layers it
looks so pretty there it is our Beauty
our chiffon cake with apple butter and
whipped cream and cinnamon on top if
this cake doesn't make you want to go
apple picking I don't know what will
